post.title: Airport, Plane, Vroom, High Altitude Vroom, Screeech, Airport, Bus, Gai Fan (Changsha to Lanzhou)
post.author: Jackson Hayes
post.content:
The lady next to me on the plane chatted with me quite a bit and helped me find the bust to the Lanzhou city center. Very helpful. Another person willing to help just because I was another human being. Hopefully this is the theme of the entire trip.

I was greeted to the north of China with just a wonderful sign when I walked around the corner. A little mom and pop 盖饭 (things on top of rice with a sauce)resturant. Enough of the crap that I was eating in the south, good food would abound for the next few days.

I hopped in the second cab that stopped for me, the first cabbie didn't know where I was trying to go, or at least he couldn't read the traditional characters that in which my hotel confirmation was written. I was accidentally on the Hong Kong site when I booked the room.

I got there and immediately confirmed my suspicion that I had booked a way too nice hotel. $50 apparently goes a long way in a hotel. I knew this fact, but didn't really think about it when I booked it in a rush the night before.

I immediately got out of the hotel and went out into the park nearby to take pictures. (The theme for the rest of the day.) The park was a sort of mountain with lots of traditional buildings. I am not exactly sure what they are called, see my pictures and you will know exactly what I mean.

After walking down from taking pictures I noticed a building that seemed to be a restaurant in the lower part of the park. I walked in and asked if I could be seated. I must have a looked confused because the lady asked what I wanted. I then, because I was then flustered and thought I was not supposed to be there, asked if it was a restaurant. She then asked me if I wanted to eat food. I said I did.

This kind of thing seems to happen a lot. I must have a confused or stupid face, because people are constantly thinking that I am confused or stupid. That or maybe I am white. 没办法.

After a solid 20 minutes trying to make sense of their menu and finding something that wasn't too expensive to eat I ordered, sat down, journaled, ate and left. When I got to the exit of the park it seemed that I was locked in the park. I stood for about thirty seconds considering what to do.

At that point I continued to the other side of the river via a walking bride taking even more pictures as I went.

After walking about an hour or so I decided to turn back. I was walking back along the river and intended to go straight back to my swanky hotel, however, I saw a side street that looked interesting enough to walk down. So I did. I was rewarded for my willingness to not lazily go back to the hotel with a wonderful little café. It really felt like I had walked into a hip little café in a trendy area in Chicago, like Roger's Park or something like that.

I ended up ordering an absolutely lovely up of warm milk tea and getting and just relaxing. Once I was seated the were playing Frank Sinatra in the background. Half way around the world, in a pretty far out the way city, you can still feel comfortable, you can still feel like you are supposed to be.

Very quickly after sitting down the manager came over and asked if he could take a picture with me on his little polaroid camera. I was of course obliging. For the most part everyone left me alone the rest of the time.

After milking my tea for about an hour I set out for the hotel and went to sleep. Or at least I thought sleep. I didn’t think about it but the milk tea had quite a lot of caffeine and sugar. So sleep was not exactly the easiest thing to achieve.  My plan for tomorrow is to get up and see the sunrise on top of the hill and get out onto the river somehow.
